author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

translation.title: The Complete Understanding of All Grasping

segments.en: 60. The Complete Understanding of All Grasping
“Mendicants, I will teach you the principle for the complete understanding of all grasping.
And what is the principle for the complete understanding of all grasping?

segments.pli: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ. Tiṇṇaṃ saṅgati phasso.
segments.en: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact.
Contact is a condition for feeling.

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi nibbindati, cakkhuviññāṇepi nibbindati, cakkhusamphassepi nibbindati, vedanāyapi nibbindati.
segments.en: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, eye contact, and feeling.

segments.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimokkhā ‘pariññātaṃ me upādānan’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they are released, they understand: ‘I have completely understood grasping.’
Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds. …
Nose consciousness arises dependent on the nose and smells. …
Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the tongue and tastes. …
Body consciousness arises dependent on the body and touches. …

segments.pli: manañca paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manoviññāṇaṃ. Tiṇṇaṃ saṅgati phasso.
segments.en: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and thoughts. The meeting of the three is contact.
Contact is a condition for feeling.

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako manasmimpi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati, manoviññāṇepi nibbindati, manosamphassepi nibbindati, vedanāyapi nibbindati.
segments.en: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the mind, thoughts, mind consciousness, mind contact, and feeling.

segments.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimokkhā ‘pariññātaṃ me upādānan’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they are released, they understand: ‘I have completely understood grasping.’
This is the principle for the complete understanding of all grasping.”
